timeSeries 4021.105
  • Reference
  • Changelog

    Get and set unit names of a 'timeSeries'

    timeSeries-slotUnits.Rd

    Gets and sets the column names of a "timeSeries" object. The column names are also called units or unit names.

    Usage

    getUnits(x)         
setUnits(x) <- value

    Arguments

    x

    a "timeSeries" object.

    value

    a character vector of unit names.

    See also

    timeSeries

    Examples

    ## A Dummy 'timeSeries' Object
   tS <- dummyMonthlySeries()
   tS
#> GMT
#>                  TS.1       TS.2
#> 2022-01-01 0.35698708 0.60189755
#> 2022-02-01 0.62747768 0.99874081
#> 2022-03-01 0.74160019 0.37559938
#> 2022-04-01 0.56596682 0.55512663
#> 2022-05-01 0.98078651 0.42944396
#> 2022-06-01 0.57681274 0.57587778
#> 2022-07-01 0.43904205 0.43250740
#> 2022-08-01 0.22859970 0.22484576
#> 2022-09-01 0.08215807 0.08498474
#> 2022-10-01 0.85026492 0.63729826
#> 2022-11-01 0.23466126 0.43101637
#> 2022-12-01 0.98816745 0.07271609

## Get the Units - 
   getUnits(tS)
#> [1] "TS.1" "TS.2"

## Assign New Units to the Series - 
   setUnits(tS) <- c("A", "B")
   head(tS)
#> GMT
#>                    A         B
#> 2022-01-01 0.3569871 0.6018975
#> 2022-02-01 0.6274777 0.9987408
#> 2022-03-01 0.7416002 0.3755994
#> 2022-04-01 0.5659668 0.5551266
#> 2022-05-01 0.9807865 0.4294440
#> 2022-06-01 0.5768127 0.5758778
